column1: 10 pts - Great job identifying the production and manufacturing processes as the business functions that could benefit from scrum/sprint methodologies. Keep up the good work!

12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how scrum/sprint could operate. Great job explaining the benefits and application of scrum/sprint methodologies in the production and manufacturing processes.

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good attempt at discussing the benefits of different methodologies for various functions, but the explanation of why kanban is a poor fit for certain functions could be clearer.

10 pts - Great job identifying the distribution and marketing functions as areas that could benefit from kanban methodologies. Your explanation of how kanban could operate in these functions is clear and well thought out. Keep up the good work!

12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job on explaining the benefits and possible columns for the kanban board in the distribution and marketing functions. Keep up the good work!

7/10 - Your discussion of the poor fit of scrum/sprint for the distribution and marketing functions is somewhat vague. Consider providing more specific reasons why these functions would not benefit from an iterative process or involving end users.

5 pts

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a relevant issue in this situation. Your explanation and suggestions for addressing it are well thought out and applicable to the case. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Right idea for definition, but some vagueness or illogic. 

Your definition of confirmation bias is generally correct, but it could be more concise and clear. Keep up the good work and focus on providing clear explanations.

12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job in providing a detailed explanation of the Agile and Kanban methodologies and their potential benefits for Mighty Jaxx. Keep up the good work!

10/10

Great job! You provided a clear and complete description of the possible steps and actions for implementing Agile methodologies in the business functions. Keep up the excellent work!
